notifications.adversaryMissing: The linked adversary doesn't exist in the world.

Automation.Hint: Various settings automating resource management and more

Homebrew.Hint: Various settings allowing extensions to types or altered game rules

Range.Label: Configure Range Handling
Range.Hint: System ruler setup for displaying ranges in Daggerheart

Appearance.title: Appearance Settings
Appearance.label: Appearance Settings
Appearance.hint: Modify the look of various parts of the system
Appearance.name: Appearance Settings

DiceSoNice.title: Dice So Nice
DiceSoNice.hint: Coloration of Hope and Fear dice if the Dice So Nice module is used.

VariantRules.title: Variant Rules
VariantRules.label: Variant Rules
VariantRules.hint: Apply variant rules from the Daggerheart system
VariantRules.name: Variant Rules

Fear.Name: Fear
Fear.Hint: Automatically increase the GM's fear pool on a fear duality roll result.

hope.label: Hope
hope.hint: Automatically increase a character's hope on a hope duality roll result.

actionPoints.label: Action Points
actionPoints.hint: Automatically give and take Action Points as combatants take their turns.

Homebrew.ResetMovesText: Are you sure you want to reset?

Fear.Name: Fear
Fear.Hint: The Fear pool of the GM.

MaxFear.Name: Maximum amount of Fear
MaxFear.Hint: The maximum amount of Fear the GM can get.

DisplayFear.Name: Fear display style
DisplayFear.Hint: Change how the GM Fear count should be displayed.

AbilityArray.Name: Ability Score Array
AbilityArray.Hint: The starting distribution of Ability Scores for a character.

RangeMeasurement.Name: Enable Range Measurement
RangeMeasurement.Hint: Enable measuring of ranges with the ruler according to set distances.

ActionTokens.label: Action Tokens
ActionTokens.hint: Give each player action tokens to use in combat

DualityRollColor.Name: Duality Roll Colour Scheme
DualityRollColor.Hint: The display type for Duality Rolls

Info.ClassCanOnlyHaveTwoDomains: A class can only have 2 domains!
Info.SelectClassBeforeSubclass: Select a Class before selecting a Subclass.
Info.SubclassNotOfClass: This Subclass doesn't belong to your current Class.
Info.AttackTargetDoesNotExist: The target token no longer exists

Error.ActionRequiresTarget: The action requires at least one target
Error.OnlyUseableByPC: This can only be used with a PC token

vulnerable.name: Vulnerable
vulnerable.description:
While a creature is Vulnerable, all rolls targeting them have advantage.
A creature who is already Vulnerable can’t be made to take the condition again.

hidden.name: Hidden
hidden.description:
While Hidden, attacks cannot be made directly targeting them nd any rolls against them are at disadvantage.
When a Hidden creature moves or attacks, they are no longer Hidden. However, if a creature is Hidden when they begin making an attack, the roll has advantage; the Hidden condition isn’t cleared until after the attack is resolved.

restrained.name: Restrained
restrained.description:
When an effect makes a creature Restrained, it means they cannot move until this condition is cleared.
They can still take actions from their current position.

horde.label: Horde
horde.description: A Horde represents a number of foes working in a group.

leader.label: Leader
leader.description: Adversaries that command and summon other adversaries.

minion.label: Minion
minion.description: Basic enemies that are easily dispatched but dangerous in numbers.

ranged.label: Ranged
ranged.description: Adversaries that attack from a distance.

skulk.label: Skulk
skulk.description: Adversaries that maneuver and exploit opportunities to ambush their opponents.

social.label: Social
social.description: Adversaries that are primarily interpersonal threats or challenges.

solo.label: Solo
solo.description: Designed to present a challenge to a whole party.

support.label: Support
support.description: Enemies that enhance their allies and/or disrupt their opponents.

Relentless.Name: Relentless
Relentless.Description: A foe with Relentless can activate up to X times during a GM move so long as there are enough action tokens.
Relentless.Tip: The Relentless move is useful if you want an adversary you can activate more than once during a single GM move. This is often best for exceedingly fast or dangerous foes, or for adversaries who are likely to be battling the party on their own.

Slow.Name: Slow
Slow.Description: A foe with Slow costs X action tokens to activate.
Slow.Tip: The Slow move is useful if you want an adversary who narratively takes longer to act than others, like a slug creature or a massive ogre. This is usually most effective when that creature is very powerful when it does act, but eats up lots of action tokens to do it.

Minion.Name: Minion
Minion.Description: For every X damage a PC deals to this adversary, they also deal 1 HP to an additional minion within their attack’s range.
Minion.Tip: The Minion move is useful when you want to drop lots of small enemies into the battlefield, knowing the party can swing through them very easily. This move means that if a PC hits one minion and they do enough damage, they also hit a number of others that are in range for them. Because of this, it’s often best to have minions crowd a PC–it will feel overwhelming and dangerous until they’re able to make an attack against them. If you want that cinematic feeling of the PCs taking out waves of enemies with a single attack roll, minions are a great tool to make that happen.

arcana.label: Arcana
arcana.Description: This is the domain of the innate or instinctual use of magic. Those who walk this path tap into the raw, enigmatic forces of the realms to manipulate both the elements and their own energy. Arcana offers wielders a volatile power, but it is incredibly potent when correctly channeled.

blade.label: Blade
blade.Description: This is the domain of those who dedicate their lives to the mastery of weapons. Whether by blade, bow, or perhaps a more specialized arm, those who follow this path have the skill to cut short the lives of others. Blade requires study and dedication from its followers, in exchange for inexorable power over death.

bone.label: Bone
bone.Description: This is the domain of mastery of swiftness and tactical mastery. Practitioners of this domain have an uncanny control over their own physical abilities, and an eye for predicting the behaviors of others in combat. Bone grants its adherents unparalleled understanding of bodies and their movements in exchange for diligent training.

codex.label: Codex
codex.Description: This is the domain of intensive magical study. Those who seek magical knowledge turn to the recipes of power recorded in books, on scrolls, etched into walls, or tattooed on bodies. Codex offers a commanding and versatile understanding of magic to those devotees who are willing to seek beyond the common knowledge.

grace.label: Grace
grace.Description: This is the domain of charisma. Through rapturous storytelling, clever charm, or a shroud of lies, those who channel this power define the realities of their adversaries, bending perception to their will. Grace offers its wielders raw magnetism and mastery over language.

midnight.label: Midnight
midnight.Description: This is the domain of shadows and secrecy. Whether by clever tricks, or cloak of night those who channel these forces are practiced in that art of obscurity and there is nothing hidden they cannot reach. Midnight offers practitioners the incredible power to control and create enigmas.

sage.label: Sage
sage.Description: This is the domain of the natural world. Those who walk this path tap into the unfettered power of the earth and its creatures to unleash raw magic. Sage grants its adherents the vitality of a blooming flower and ferocity of a hungry predator.

splendor.label: Splendor
splendor.Description: This is the domain of life. Through this magic, followers gain the ability to heal, though such power also grants the wielder some control over death. Splendor offers its disciples the magnificent ability to both give and end life.

valor.label: Valor
valor.Description: This is the domain of protection. Whether through attack or defense, those who choose this discipline channel formidable strength to protect their allies in battle. Valor offers great power to those who raise their shield in defense of others.

Notifications.SubclassNotInClass: This subclass does not belong to your selected class.
Notifications.MissingClass: You don't have a class selected yet.
Notifications.WrongDomain: The card isn't from one of your class domains.
Notifications.CardTooHighLevel: The card is too high level!
Notifications.DuplicateCard: You cannot select the same card more than once.
Notifications.NotPrimary: The weapon is not a primary weapon!
Notifications.NotSecondary: The weapon is not a secondary weapon!
Notifications.ItemTooHighTier: The item must be from Tier1
Notifications.PrimaryIsTwoHanded: Cannot select a secondary weapon with a two-handed primary!

Options.trait: Gain a +1 bonus to two unmarked character traits and mark them.
Options.hitPoint: Permanently gain one Hit Point slot.
Options.experience: Permanently gain a +1 bonus to two experiences.
Options.domainCard: Choose an additional domain card of your level or lower from a domain you have access to (up to level {maxLevel})
Options.evasion: Permanently gain a +1 bonus to your Evasion.
Options.subclass: Take an upgraded subclass card. Then cross out the multiclass option for this tier.
Options.multiclass: Multiclass: Choose an additional class for your character, then cross out an unused “Take an upgraded subclass card” and the other multiclass option on this sheet.
Options.intelligent: Your companion gains a permanent +1 bonus to a Companion Experience of your choice.
Options.lightInTheDark: Gain an additional Hope slot for your character.
Options.creatureComfort: Once per rest, when you take time during a quiet moment to give your companion love and attention, you can gain a Hope or you can both clear a Stress.
Options.armored: When your companion takes damage, you can mark one of your Armor Slots instead of marking one of their Stress.
Options.vicious: Increase your companion's damage dice or range by one step (d6 to d8, Close to Far, etc.)
Options.resilient: Your companion gains an additional Stress slot.
Options.bonded: When you mark your last Hit Point, your companion rushes to your side to comfort you. Roll a number of d6s equal to the unmarked Stress slots they have and mark them. If any roll a 6, your companion helps you up. Clear your last Hit Point and return to the scene.
Options.aware: Your companion gains a permanent +2 bonus to their Evasion.

CreatureComfort.Name: Creature Comfort
CreatureComfort.Description: Once per rest, when you take time during a quiet moment to give your companion love and attention, you can gain a Hope or you can both clear a Stress.

Armored.Name: Armored
Armored.Description: When your companion takes damage, you can mark one of your Armor Slots instead of marking one of their Stress.

Bonded.Name: Bonded
Bonded.Description: When you mark your last Hit Point, your companion rushes to your side to comfort you. Roll a number of d6s equal to the unmarked Stress slots they have and mark them. If any roll a 6, your companion helps you up. Clear your last Hit Point and return to the scene.

Tier2.Label: Levels 2-4
Tier2.InfoLabel: At Level 2, gain an additional Experience at +2 and gain a +1 bonus to your Proficiency.
Tier2.Pretext: Choose two options from the list below
Tier2.Posttext: Take an additional domain card of your level or lower from a domain you have access to.

Tier3.Label: Levels 5-7
Tier3.InfoLabel: At Level 5, take an additional Experience and clear all marks on Character Traits.
Tier3.Pretext: When you level up, record it on your character sheet, then choose two from the list below or any unmarked from the previous tier.
Tier3.Posttext: Take an additional domain card of your level or lower from a domain you have access to.

Tier4.Label: Levels 8-10
Tier4.InfoLabel: At Level 8, take an additional Experience and clear all marks on Character Traits.
Tier4.Pretext: When you level up, record it on your character sheet, then choose two from the list below or any unmarked from the previous tier.
Tier4.Posttext: Take an additional domain card of your level or lower from a domain you have access to.

ChoiceDescriptions.Attributes: Gain a +1 bonus to two unmarked character traits and mark them.
ChoiceDescriptions.HitPointSlots: Permanently gain one Hit Point slot.
ChoiceDescriptions.Experiences: Permanently gain a +1 bonus to two experiences.
ChoiceDescriptions.DomainCard: Choose an additional domain card of your level or lower from a domain you have access to (up to level {maxLevel})
ChoiceDescriptions.Evasion: Permanently gain a +1 bonus to your Evasion.
ChoiceDescriptions.Subclass: Take an upgraded subclass card. Then cross out the multiclass option for this tier.
ChoiceDescriptions.Multiclass: Multiclass: Choose an additional class for your character, then cross out an unused “Take an upgraded subclass card” and the other multiclass option on this sheet.

TendToWounds.Name: Tend to Wounds
TendToWounds.Description: Describe how you hastily patch yourself up, then clear a number of Hit Points equal to 1d4 + your tier. You can do this to an ally instead.

ClearStress.Name: Clear Stress
ClearStress.Description: Describe how you blow off steam or pull yourself together, then clear a number of Stress equal to 1d4 + your tier.

RepairArmor.Name: Repair Armor
RepairArmor.Description: Describe how you quickly repair your armor, then clear a number of Armor Slots equal to 1d4 + your tier. You can do this to an ally's armor instead.

Prepare.Name: Prepare
Prepare.Description: Describe how you prepare yourself for the path ahead, then gain a Hope. If you choose to Prepare with one or more members of your party, you each gain 2 Hope.

TendToWounds.Name: Tend to Wounds
TendToWounds.Description: Describe how you patch yourself up and remove all marked Hit Points. You may also do this on an ally instead.

ClearStress.Name: Clear Stress
ClearStress.Description: Describe how you blow off steam or pull yourself together, and clear all marked Stress.

RepairArmor.Name: Repair Armor
RepairArmor.Description: Describe how you spend time repairing your armor and clear all of its Armor Slots. You may also do this to an ally's armor instead.

Prepare.Name: Prepare
Prepare.Description: Describe how you are preparing for the next day's adventure, then gain a Hope. If you choose to Prepare with one or more members of your party, you may each take two Hope.

WorkOnAProject.Name: Work on a Project
WorkOnAProject.Description: Establish or continue work on a project.

Notifications.NoMoreMoves: You cannot select any more downtime moves

AvoidDeath.Name: Avoid Death
AvoidDeath.Description: You drop unconscious temporarily and work with the GM to describe how the situation gets much worse because of it. Then roll your Fear die; if its value is equal to or under your Level, take a Scar.

RiskItAll.Name: Risk It All
RiskItAll.Description: Roll your Duality Dice. If Hope is higher, you stay on your feet and clear an amount of Hit Points and/or Stress equal to the value of the Hope die (divide the Hope die value up between these however you’d prefer). If your Fear die is higher, you cross through the veil of death. If the Duality Dice are tied, you stay on your feet and clear all Hit Points and Stress.

BlazeOfGlory.Name: Blaze Of Glory
BlazeOfGlory.Description: With Blaze of Glory, the player is accepting death for the character. Take one action (at GM discretion), which becomes an automatic critical success, then cross through the veil of death.

melee.name: Melee
melee.description: means a character is within touching distance of the target. PCs can generally touch targets up to a few feet away from them, but melee range may be greater for especially large NPCs.

veryClose.name: Very Close
veryClose.description: means a distance where one can see fine details of a target- within moments of reaching, if need be. This is usually anywhere from about 5-10 feet away. While in danger, a PC can usually get to anything that’s very close as part of any other action they take. Anything on a battle map that is within the shortest length of a game card (~2-3 inches) can usually be considered very close.

close.name: Close
close.description: means a distance where one can see prominent details of a target-- across a room or to a neighboring market stall, generally about 10-30 feet away. While in danger, a PC can usually get to anything that’s close as part of any other action they take. Anything on a battle map that is within the length of a standard pen or pencil (~5-6 inches) can usually be considered close.

far.name: Far
far.description: means a distance where one can see the appearance of a person or object, but probably not in great detail-- across a small battlefield or down a large corridor. This is usually about 30-100 feet away. While under danger, a PC will likely have to make an Agility check to get here safely. Anything on a battle map that is within the length of a standard piece of paper (~10-11 inches) can usually be considered far.

veryFar.name: Very Far
veryFar.description: means a distance where you can see the shape of a person or object, but probably not make outany details-- across a large battlefield or down a long street, generally about 100-300 feet away. While under danger, a PC likely has to make an Agility check to get here safely. Anything on a battle map that is beyond far distance, but still within sight of the characters can usually be considered very far.

Burning.Name: Burning
Burning.Description: When an adversary attacks you within Melee range, they mark a Stress.

Difficult.Name: Difficult
Difficult.Description: -1 to all character traits and Evasion

Fortified.Name: Fortified
Fortified.Description: When you mark an Armor Slot, you reduce the severity of an attack by two thresholds instead of one.

Hopeful.Name: Hopeful
Hopeful.Description: When you would spend a Hope, you can mark an Armor Slot instead.

Impenetrable.Name: Impenetrable
Impenetrable.Description: Once per short rest, when you would mark your last Hit Point, you can instead mark a Stress.

Magic.Name: Magic
Magic.Description: You can't mark an Armor Slot to reduce physical damage.

Painful.Name: Painful
Painful.Description: Each time you mark an Armor Slot, you must mark a Stress.

Physical.Name: Physical
Physical.Description: You can't mark an Armor Slot to reduce magic damage.

Quiet.Name: Quiet
Quiet.Description: You gain a +2 bonus to rolls you make to move silently.

Reinforced.Name: Reinforced
Reinforced.Description: When you mark your last Armor Slot, increase your damage thresholds by +2 until you clear at least 1 Armor Slot.

Resilient.Name: Resilient
Resilient.Description: Before you mark your last Armor Slot, roll a d6. On a result of 6, reduce the severity by one threshold without marking an Armor Slot.

Sharp.Name: Sharp
Sharp.Description: On a successful attack against a target within Melee range, add a d4 to the damage roll.

Shifting.Name: Shifting
Shifting.Description: When you are targeted for an attack, you can mark an Armor Slot to give the attack roll against you disadvantage.

Timeslowing.Name: Timeslowing
Timeslowing.Description: Mark an Armor Slot to roll a d4 and add its result as a bonus to your Evasion against an incoming attack.

Truthseeking.Name: Truthseeking
Truthseeking.Description: This armor glows when another creature within Close range tells a lie.

Warded.Name: Warded
Warded.Description: You reduce incoming magic damage by your Armor Score before applying it to your damage thresholds.

Bonded.Name: Bonded
Bonded.Description: Gain a bonus to your damage rolls equal to your level.

Bouncing.Name: Bouncing
Bouncing.Description: Mark 1 or more Stress to hit that many targets in range of the attack.

Brave.Name: Brave
Brave.Description: -1 to Evasion; +3 to Severe damage threshold

Brutal.Name: Brutal
Brutal.Description: When you roll the maximum value on a damage die, roll an additional damage die.

Charged.Name: Charged
Charged.Description: Mark a Stress to gain a +1 bonus to your Proficiency on a primary weapon attack.

Concussive.Name: Concussive
Concussive.Description: On a successful attack, you can spend a Hope to knock the target back to Far range.

Deadly.Name: Deadly
Deadly.Description: When you deal Severe damage, the target must mark an additional HP.

Deflecting.Name: Deflecting
Deflecting.Description: When you are attacked, you can mark an Armor Slot to gain a bonus to your Evasion equal to your Armor Score against the attack.

Destructive.Name: Destructive
Destructive.Description: -1 to Agility; on a successful attack, all adversaries within Very Close range must mark a Stress.

Devastating.Name: Devastating
Devastating.Description: Before you make an attack roll, you can mark a Stress to use a d20 as your damage die.

DoubleDuty.Name: Double Duty
DoubleDuty.Description: +1 to Armor Score; +1 to primary weapon damage within Melee range

DoubledUp.Name: Doubled Up
DoubledUp.Description: When you make an attack with your primary weapon, you can deal damage to another target within Melee range.

Dueling.Name: Dueling
Dueling.Description: When there are no other creatures within Close range of the target, gain advantage on your attack roll against them.

Eruptive.Name: Eruptive
Eruptive.Description: On a successful attack against a target within Melee range, all other adversaries within Very Close range must succeed on a reaction roll (14) or take half damage.

Grappling.Name: Grappling
Grappling.Description: On a successful attack, you can spend a Hope to Restrain the target or pull them into Melee range with you.

Greedy.Name: Greedy
Greedy.Description: Spend a handful of gold to gain a +1 bonus to your Proficiency on a damage roll.

Healing.Name: Healing
Healing.Description: During downtime, automatically clear a Hit Point.

Hooked.Name: Hooked
Hooked.Description: On a successful attack, you can pull the target into Melee range.

Hot.Name: Hot
Hot.Description: This weapon cuts through solid material.

Invigorating.Name: Invigorating
Invigorating.Description: On a successful attack, roll a d4. On a result of 4, clear a Stress.

Lifestealing.Name: Lifestealing
Lifestealing.Description: On a successful attack, roll a d6. On a result of 6, clear a Hit Point or clear a Stress.

LockedOn.Name: Locked On
LockedOn.Description: On a successful attack, your next attack against the same target with your primary weapon automatically succeeds.

Lucky.Name: Lucky
Lucky.Description: On a failed attack, you can mark a Stress to reroll your attack.

Long.Name: Long
Long.Description: This weapon's attack targets all adversaries in a line within range.

Massive.Name: Massive
Massive.Description: -1 to Evasion; on a successful attack, roll an additional damage die and discard the lowest result.

Painful.Name: Painful
Painful.Description: Each time you make a successful attack, you must mark a Stress.

Paired.Name: Paired
Paired.Description: +{bonusDamage} to primary weapon damage to targets within Melee range

Parry.Name: Parry
Parry.Description: When you are attacked, roll this weapon's damage dice. If any of the attacker's damage dice rolled the same value as your dice, the matching results are discarded from the attacker's damage dice before the damage you take is totaled.

Persuasive.Name: Persuasive
Persuasive.Description: Before you make a Presence Roll, you can mark a Stress to gain a +2 bonus to the result.

Pompous.Name: Pompous
Pompous.Description: You must have a Presence of 0 or lower to use this weapon.

Powerful.Name: Powerful
Powerful.Description: On a successful attack, roll an additional damage die and discard the lowest result.

Quick.Name: Quick
Quick.Description: When you make an attack, you can mark a Stress to target another creature within range.

Reloading.Name: Reloading
Reloading.Description: After you make an attack, roll a d6. On a result of 1, you must mark a Stress to reload this weapon before you can fire it again.

Retractable.Name: Retractable
Retractable.Description: The blade can be hidden in the hilt to avoid detection.

Returning.Name: Returning
Returning.Description: When this weapon is thrown within its range, it appears in your hand immediately after the attack.

Scary.Name: Scary
Scary.Description: On a successful attack, the target must mark a Stress.

Serrated.Name: Serrated
Serrated.Description: When you roll a 1 on a damage die, it deals 8 damage instead.

Sharpwing.Name: Sharpwing
Sharpwing.Description: Gain a bonus to your damage rolls equal to your Agility.

Sheltering.Name: Sheltering
Sheltering.Description: When you mark an Armor Slot, it reduces damage for you and all allies within Melee range of you who took the same damage.

Startling.Name: Startling
Startling.Description: Mark a Stress to crack the whip and force all adversaries within Melee range back to Close range.

Timebending.Name: Timebending
Timebending.Description: You can choose the target of your attack after making your attack roll.

Versatile.Name: Versatile
Versatile.Description: This weapon can also be used with these statistics—{characterTrait}, {range}, {damage}.

Delevel.title: Go back to previous level
Delevel.content: Returning to the previous level selection will remove all selections made for this level. Do you want to proceed?

info.insufficentAdvancements: You don't have enough advancements left.
info.insufficientTierAdvancements: You have no available advancements for this tier.

error.domainCardWrongDomain: You don't have access to that Domain
error.domainCardToHighLevel: The Domain Card is too high level to be selected
error.domainCardDuplicate: You already have that domain card!

Countdown.RemoveCountdownText: Are you sure you want to remove the countdown: {name}?
Countdown.Title: {type} Countdowns

Notifications.LimitedOwnershipMaximise: You don't have permission to enter edit view

DamageReduction.Title: Damage Reduction
DamageReduction.ArmorWithStress: Spend 1 stress to use an extra mark
DamageReduction.UnncessaryStress: You don't need to expend stress

Notifications.DamageAlreadyNone: The damage has already been reduced to none
Notifications.NoAvailableArmorMarks: You have no more available armor marks

PC.Name: Name

Hope.Title: Hope
Hope.Description: Spend Hope to use an experience or help an ally.

PC.DeleteConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete the item - {item}?

Errors.missingClassOrSubclass: The character doesn't have a class and subclass
Errors.tooHighLevel: You cannot raise the character level past the maximum
Errors.tooLowLevel: You cannot lower the character level below starting level

potentialAdversaries.label: Potential Adversaries
potentialAdversaries.placeholder: Optionally drag and drop adversaries here

Description.Title: Character Description
Description.Explanation: Choose one (or more) from each line, or make your own

Errors.MissingClass: The character is missing a class
Errors.SubclassNotInClass: The subclass does not belong to the character's class
Errors.ClassAlreadySelected: The character already has a class
Errors.SubclassAlreadySelected: The character already has a subclass for that class.
Errors.NoClassSelected: Your character has no class selected!
Errors.LacksDomain: Your character doesn't have the domain of the card!
Errors.MaxLoadoutReached: You can't have any more domain cards at this level!
Errors.DuplicateDomainCard: You already have a domain card with that name!
